text: Anne Baxter (May 7, 1923 â€“ December 12, 1985) was an American actress. She appeared in many movies. She starred in the 1946 movie The Razor's Edge, and received an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for that performance. She also acted in The Ten Commandments in 1956 and the Broadway play Applause. Her grandfather was architect Frank Lloyd Wright. The actress was born in Michigan City, Indiana. She died from an aneurysm in New York City at sixty- two. title: Anne Baxter
